result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Catelin Ringersma in court for State of Wisconsin. Court grants Atty Fard's motion to withdraw. Defense request additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant.

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms appeared by video.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Deandre Dwayne Simms.  Attorney Catelin Ringersma appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense advise of leaving office and filing of motion. Court sets status of counsel in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial. Defense request adjournment of final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders any suppression motion due by 9-19-2022 9:30 am. Court grants adjournment request. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case brought in to address motion hearing adjournment request. Defense request additional time. State does not object. Court grants additional time. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defense filed motion to modify bail.  Defense addresses extradition case.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense requests another bail review to be addressed during the motion hearing scheduled on July 28, 2022 at 3:30 PM.  Case adjourned to Branch 04.
Defense Motion to Reduce Cash Bail.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises court that will not be able to prepared to proceed with speedy trial date. Defense requesting adjourment of jury trial date and withdrawn of speedy trial demand. Defense request motion hearing date before new jury trial dates.  Court grants withdraw of speedy trial demand for reasons stated on the record. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4. 
  Motion hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense's motion to withdraw heard. State takes no position. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court vacates motion hearing set for 5-19-2022. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deandre D Simms in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deandre D Simms in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer C. Conway.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.
HIDTA CASE

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION - Court Reminders.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Deandre D Simms in Court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deandre D Simms in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4 -- HIDTA Case. Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Defendant advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed  Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
